Indrag^n :stat 34. Handh. tskogsslköts. å Prims Carl’s inrättn. å Gåfön 10-40. Liänissaklk. h. fastigh iprövn :nd i Goitl. 11. 28-38. Rev. å här:- o. s inalmiäriL i östergötl. fr. 34. translated: Tyra Elisabet, married, Norrköping, b. 7/6/91 in Brunskog, Värmland. 1st child of the manager August Nordquist and Mathilda Friberger. Married on 14th with Colonel Martin W. Children: Britt b. 15, Ulla b. 19, Ann-Marie b. 21, Kerstin b. 24, Barbro b. 26. Initiated into the Lotta Svärdsrör in Sweden, contributed to several Lotta corps. Served as president of Stockholm Lotta corps from 1924 to 1928, Växjö Lotta corps from 1928 to 1934, Halmstad Lotta corps from 1937 to 1939, and East Östergötland Lotta association from 1943 as vice president of the Lotta supreme board from 1932 to 1942, honorary member of Halland County Council, Stockholm, Norrtälje, Halmstad, and Växjö Lotta corps. Traveled to Finland in 1924, 1925, 1931, and 1941 for Lotta Svärd studies. Commissioned by the Swedish County Association to compile a guide on the activities of county women's associations. Edited the magazine "Den svenska lottan" from 1936 to 1946. Awarded 8 decorations, including the Landstorm Golden Medal and a silver coat of arms, and received honorary membership in various Lotta corps. Einar Olof Albert P'son, forester, Linköping, b. 3/11/84 in Atvid, Östergötland. 1st child of forester Olof Peterson and Helena Elisabet Wadstein. Married on the 16th to Anna Rudiberg. Children: Lars b. 19, Pehr b. 21, Ulf b. 26. Completed his studies in Linköping in 1903, graduated from the forestry institute in 1906. Became a forester in the eastern district in 1907, assistant county forester in Värmland in 1907, temporary appointment to state service from 1907 to 1908, assistant in the Stockholm district in 1909, Slättbyigids district in 1912, chief forester assistant in the eastern district from 1913 to 1919, forest assessor in the same district from 1920. Retired in 1934. Managed forestry at count Carl's institution at Gåfön from 1910 to 1940. County examiner in real estate appraisal in Gotland from 1911 to 1918 and from 1928 to 1938. Auditor of the army and sea defense in Östergötland from 1934. Consultant in various activities. Hobbies: hunting and wildlife conservation. Guninar Ebert Wadstén, editor, Varberg, b. 7/4/14 in Varberg. Child of wholesaler John Johnson and Anna Wadstén. Married in 1946 to Lillemor Kjelilqvist. Child: Ann-Louise b. 47. Completed her secondary education in Varberg in 1931, completed a course in commerce at Odertz Commercial Institute. Employed by Hallands Nyheter, editorial staff in Varberg from 1931. Secretary of Varberg Scout Corps from 1931 to 1934, secretary of the gymnastics club from 1930 to 1943, secretary of the canoe club Bris from 1942 to 1944, member of the tennis club since 1937. Hobbies: tennis, bridge, skiing. Arne Colbiörnsen Wærn, merchant, Gothenburg, b. 2/10/83 in Gothenburg. Child of wholesaler Peder W. and Sigrid Möller. Married in 19xx to Baroness Margareta von Rosen. Children: Lennart b. 18, B.A., Lund, Olof b. 20, employed in paternal company, Gothenburg, Kerstin b. 21, married to notary Gunnar Engström, Gothenburg. Studied at Gothenburg's real school and Gothenburg's commercial institute. Works as a director in A-B C. Fr. Wærn & Co. and Hamn A-B Tingstad. Member of the board in B.E.A. Planting Co., Dalslands Kanal A-B, A-B Billingsfors-Långed, Sweden's Mutual Cattle Insurance Company, Gothenburg Animal Protection Association.
